function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Decreasing burden of negative information about COVID-19 in media may decrease stress but also public interest in COVID-19 news.","Impact":"Decreased public awareness and interest in COVID-19 news, potential lack of urgency in following safety measures.","Mitigation":"Balancing positive and negative information in media coverage, providing accurate and engaging content to maintain public interest.","Technologies":"AI-driven content curation tools, social media listening and sentiment analysis tools.","People":"General public, media outlets, content creators, public health officials.","Owner":"Media organizations, public health agencies, content creators."},{"Description":"Greater utilization of secondary interpersonal information sources like friends and relatives may increase the risk of COVID-19 fatigue and decrease interest in pandemic news.","Impact":"Reduced motivation to follow safety guidelines, decreased engagement with pandemic updates.","Mitigation":"Promoting accurate and balanced information sharing within personal networks, encouraging discussions about pandemic impact and response.","Technologies":"Social network analysis tools, communication platforms for personal networks, digital mental health support tools.","People":"Those who rely on friends/relatives for COVID-19 information, public health officials, mental health professionals.","Owner":"Public health agencies, mental health organizations, social media platforms."},{"Description":"Increased reliance on healthcare professionals for COVID-19 information may lead to greater trust in the information but could result in decreased public interest in pandemic news.","Impact":"Potential lack of interest in pandemic updates, reduced awareness of evolving health guidance and recommendations.","Mitigation":"Enhancing the communication skills of healthcare professionals to engage public interest, integrating public health messaging in healthcare settings.","Technologies":"Telemedicine platforms, patient education apps, communication training and resources for healthcare professionals.","People":"Healthcare professionals, general public seeking COVID-19 information, public health officials.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, public health agencies, professional associations."}]}
